- [ ] Performance improvement
- [ ] Test coverage improvement

## Checklist

<!-- Mark completed items with an "x" -->

### Code Quality

- [ ] My code follows the project's style guidelines (ESLint, Prettier)
- [ ] I have performed a self-review of my own code
- [ ] I have commented my code, particularly in hard-to-understand areas
- [ ] My changes generate no new warnings or errors
- [ ] I have followed SOLID principles and OOP best practices
- [ ] I have followed the Service → Repository → Data layer pattern

### Testing

- [ ] I have added tests that prove my fix is effective or that my feature works
- [ ] New and existing unit tests pass locally with my changes
- [ ] New and existing E2E tests pass locally with my changes

### Documentation

- [ ] I have updated the documentation accordingly
- [ ] I have updated type definitions if needed
- [ ] I have added JSDoc comments to new functions/classes

### Database

- [ ] I have created necessary database migrations
- [ ] Migrations are reversible (have both `up` and `down`)
- [ ] I have updated seed data if needed

### Security

- [ ] My changes do not introduce security vulnerabilities
- [ ] I have not committed sensitive data (API keys, passwords, etc.)
- [ ] I have validated all user inputs
- [ ] I have added proper authorization checks

### Performance

- [ ] I have considered the performance impact of my changes
- [ ] I have optimized database queries if applicable
- [ ] I have added appropriate caching where needed

## Deployment Notes

<!-- Any special instructions for deployment? -->

- [ ] Requires environment variable changes (document in PR description)
- [ ] Requires database migration (will run automatically on Railway)
- [ ] Requires data migration or backfill
- [ ] Breaking changes (document migration path)

## CI/CD Status

Once you create this PR, the following checks will run automatically:

- ✅ Lint & Format Check
- ✅ TypeScript Type Check
- ✅ Unit Tests
- ✅ E2E Tests
- ✅ Build Check

**All checks must pass before merging.**

If any check fails:

1. Click "Details" next to the failed check
2. Review the error logs
3. Fix the issue locally
4. Push new commit to this branch
